channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report X-2024100955
item.description:
Report X-2024100955

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-17T09:14:53+00:00

  • City: OAKLAND

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS FOUND, LEAKING ON THE IR-1 BELT NEAR DMP AREA. USING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, PACKAGE WAS CONTAINED, AREA WAS CLEANED, AND PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.description:

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HAZMAT RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE UNLOAD. UPON ARRIVAL NOTICED A CLASS 8 DIAMOND LABEL, FOLLOWED DECISION TREE WHICH LED TO CORRISIVE RESPONSE SHEET. FOLLOWED ACTION STEPS TO CLEAN UP SPILL AND BROUGHT TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024100363
item.description:
Report E-2024100363

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-17T09:14:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-04
  • City: FRESNO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 4, 2024, three (3) 50-pound bag of UN2680 was torn in transit and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. TWE personnel absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. The damaged bags and all impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024100918
item.description:
Report X-2024100918

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-17T09:14:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-28
  • City: ALISO VIEJO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE CAR DRIVER WAS SUSPICIOUS OF THE CONTENTS OF THE PACKAGE. THEREFORE HE BROUGHT IT TO THE ACCEPTANCE AUDITOR WHO THEN BROUGHT IT TO MY, THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER, ATTENTION. OPENED THE PACKAGE TO CONFIRM THE CONTENTS AND DISCOVERED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS A HAZMAT AND LACKED ANY OF THE LABELING AND PAPERWORK FOR A PROPER HAZARDOUS MATERIAL SHIPMENT. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS: 1ZC1G375YT43362982, 1ZC1G375YT52733242, 1ZC1G375YT51848773, 1ZC1G375YT44826961, 1ZC1G375YW56285134, 1ZC1G375YT98949693, 1ZC1G375YT86212287, 1ZC1G375YT50041556, 1ZC1G375YT48566253 AND 1ZC1G375YT63739663

item.title: Report X-2024100711
item.description:
Report X-2024100711

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-17T09:14:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-25
  • City: Sacremento
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 9/25/2024 at approximately 1030, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 957951 at the ramp facility in Sacramento, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing two fiberboard boxes with a fire extinguisher in each inner box. The shipment was discovered showing a powder residue on the outer package and on the aircraft floor. Further investigation revealed that the shipment contained fire extinguishers that were missing the secure pin. Additionally, the package was not prepared in accordance with IATA regulations, missing the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork on the outermost pacakge. The shipment is being held, pending in FAA investigation.

  • Description: Upon inspection of the package it was discovered that the outside of the box contained no evidence that the product was damaged. With further investigation it was found that the contents were hazardous materials per the SDS even though the label and the outside of the box contained no indication of it being a hazmat.

item.title: Report E-2024100354
item.description:
Report E-2024100354

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-16T09:16:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-25
  • City: ORANGE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 07:51 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (UOR) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately .25 cup of ChemTreat CL561 (hazardous - UN2796) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the pallet and did not impact the trailer floor and since dried. The terminal advised there is no longer a leak, and they advised they will place the damaged jug into a 30 gallon poly drum to be staged for terminal personnel to manage. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report X-2024100681
item.description:
Report X-2024100681

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-27
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN FREMONT, CALIFORNIA, ONE AIR PACKAGE TO MALAYSIA WAS BEING INSPECTED PRIOR TO EXPORT. THE OUTER BOX IS ULINE HAZARDOUS MATERIALS PACKAGING WITH FOUR OSHA NFPA LABELS APPLIED INDICATING FLAMMABILITY HAZARD 1, HEALTH HAZARD 2 AND INSTABILITY HAZARD 0. PACKAGE CONTENT INSPECTION REVEALS A FIVE GALLON 1A1 STEEL DRUM OF FLAMMABLE SHELL D-38, MINERAL SPIRITS 66.1% AROM. THE OSHA NFPA LABEL ON THE STEEL DRUM INDICATES FLAMMABILITY HAZARD 2 WITH A FLASH POINT RANGE OF 104 - 115 F, WHICH IS REGULATED IN AIR TRANSPORTATION. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-17

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY THREE POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING A COMPUTER CHIP. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 279E20, KEVIN ZHU, 35675 CHAPLIN DR, FREMONT CA 94536-2525.
